Articles.Content: OK here is the challenge you have to land on all the moons in one laneJch and flight, the last planet to land on should be the ocean moon and the caft has to be stock parts only. and have to have pictures the prove you did it. and post them here
Might as well add cure cancer to that list, as I don't see that happening the coming few years. I'ts hard enough to go to moon/min/kerbin.

Remove the 'stock parts only' and you might be able to accomplish it with ion engines and a lander/orbiter with docking clamps (Erkle's/Hogdriver's) to connect them. Kethane would probably do for replenishing fuel on the lander, just make sure you land somewhere you can harvest some.
Totally got a ship that'll do that, already hopped between two of them. I'll get on that this week.

Totally got a ship that'll do that, already hopped between two of them. I'll get on that this week.

This man has the right attitude.
Anyone who doubts this being possible with stock parts has severely underestimated the new nuclear engine.
Nuclear engines good its just getting the craft with the engine into space. With patients.

I have a craft capable of getting 2x 3M fuel tanks to kerbin escape velocity, it has a tricoupler at the bottom with 3 nuke engines and a lander up top with a 1m tank of fuel and the 200 thrust vectoring engine.
Anything is doable with docking, even stock, so I say just stock/docking mods and it's fair game.
I don' know what mean caft,so i can't show you my super grandtour(all planets and moons in one mission,even Kerbin moons)
I'll start on this once I finish my mission to Eve and back.
First and second attempts - failures. Looks like I can only attach 5 pictures to a post...

Unfortunately I hit the Joolian system in a retrograde orbit. I didn't have enough delta-v to stick it back round the right way and ended up slingshotting out of the Kerbol system at a rate of knots. I'll try again tomorrow...
I've landed on 3 moons in one mission, but Tylo is a tough cookie, is orbital rendezvous allowed?

Unfortunately I hit the Joolian system in a retrograde orbit. I didn't have enough delta-v to stick it back round the right way and ended up slingshotting out of the Kerbol system at a rate of knots. I'll try again tomorrow...

Aerobraking comes to mind. It would have solved all your problems.

I don' know what mean caft,so i can't show you my super grandtour(all planets and moons in one mission,even Kerbin moons)

"craft" maybe? i'd like to see your super grandtour, sir!
I believe the original poster never said config edits weren't against the rules :/ Correct me if I'm wrong though.

Aerobraking comes to mind. It would have solved all your problems.

I can never get my head around gauging how much to aerobrake by. Always end up dunking into a planet or not really affecting my orbit at all. Still, it's an idea for the second shot if I hit it retrograde again.
